importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, marking the culmination of the ALCS and the beginning of the World Series matchup between the Blue Jays and Dodgers.
The scheduled start date of Game 1 of the World Series, signaling the official beginning of the championship showdown.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period from July to October 2025 covers the Blue Jays' remarkable turnaround from last-place finish in 2024 to a top-of-the-AL East finish, and their journey through the postseason.

keyTakeAways: The Toronto Blue Jays won the American League Championship Series (ALCS) in seven games against the Seattle Mariners, advancing to their first World Series since 1993.
The Los Angeles Dodgers, with the largest payroll in baseball, are a dominant postseason force, having won two World Series titles and five NL pennants in the past nine years.

Shohei Ohtani delivered a historic performance in Game 4 of the NLCS, hitting three home runs and pitching 6.1 shutout innings with 10 strikeouts, a performance considered one of the greatest individual games in baseball history.
The Blue Jays’ strength in putting the ball into play helped them overcome the Mariners in the ALCS, but the Dodgers’ superior pitching and defense make them a formidable opponent.
The Dodgers’ bullpen struggled during the regular season, creating a potential vulnerability the Blue Jays could exploit during the World Series.
The World Series begins on Friday, October 24, in Toronto, with the Blue Jays facing off against the Dodgers.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball (MLB) team based in Toronto, Canada
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays are the primary opponents in the World Series and have just won the ALCS, marking their first appearance in the World Series since 1993.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball (MLB) team based in Los Angeles, California
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are the defending World Series champions and have a strong postseason record, making them a significant and challenging opponent for the Blue Jays.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball (MLB) team based in Seattle, Washington
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners were the opponents of the Blue Jays in the ALCS and were initially leading the series, but were eliminated due to errors and a late home run by George Springer.

namedEntities.name: Shohei Ohtani
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A two-way superstar player for the Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ohtani delivered a historic performance in Game 4 of the NLCS, hitting three home runs and pitching a shutout, making it a key factor in the Dodgers' advancement.

namedEntities.name: George Springer
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A key player for the Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Springer hit a late three-run home run in Game 7 of the ALCS, which ended the Mariners' hopes and was pivotal in the Blue Jays’ victory.

namedEntities.name: Jeff Hoffman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A pitcher for the Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hoffman provided commentary after the Blue Jays' ALCS win, emphasizing the team's resilience and the importance of staying close throughout the series.

namedEntities.name: American League Championship Series (ALCS)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The playoff series determining the American League representative for the World Series
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays won this series in seven games against the Mariners, advancing to the World Series for the first time since 1993.

namedEntities.name: National League Championship Series (NLCS)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The playoff series determining the National League representative for the World Series
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers won the NLCS in four games against the Milwaukee Brewers, demonstrating their dominance in the postseason.

namedEntities.name: World Series
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The championship playoff series between the American League and National League champions
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays and Dodgers are set to face off in the World Series, marking a pivotal moment in MLB postseason history.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Fox broadcast Jeff Hoffman’s postgame interview, providing fans with commentary on the Blue Jays’ success in the ALCS.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Brewers were swept by the Dodgers in the NLCS, highlighting the Dodgers’ postseason dominance.

namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An MLB team that lost to the Dodgers in September 2025
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Pirates' sweep in September demonstrated the Dodgers’ bullpen instability during the regular season.

namedEntities.name: AL East
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A division in Major League Baseball
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays finished atop the AL East with a 94-68 record in 2025, marking a dramatic turnaround from their 2024 performance.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays have advanced to the World Series after defeating the Seattle Mariners in a seven-game ALCS, marking their first appearance since 1993. The Blue Jays, who turned around from a last-place finish in 2024 to a 94-68 record and strong offensive performance, narrowly overcame the Mariners with a 4-3 series win, including a decisive Game 7 loss where the Mariners committed critical errors and allowed a late home run by George Springer. The Los Angeles Dodgers, with the largest payroll and a record of two World Series titles and five NL pennants over the past nine seasons, are the defending champions and face the Blue Jays in the World Series, starting on October 24. The Dodgers' postseason dominance — including a dominant 4-0 NLCS victory over the Brewers and a standout performance by Shohei Ohtani — makes them a formidable opponent. However, the Dodgers’ struggling bullpen presents a potential vulnerability that the Blue Jays could exploit. This matchup represents a pivotal moment in MLB postseason history, with the Blue Jays returning to the championship stage after over three decades and the Dodgers aiming for their first repeat title in 25 years.
title: Dodgers and Blue Jays Set for World Series Clash After ALCS Victory
